unnormalised: **Automotive News: Recent Vehicle Launches Focus on Sustainability and Affordability**
normalised: **Automotive News: Recent Vehicle Launches Focus on Sustainability and Affordability**

unnormalised: This month saw a flurry of vehicle launches across various segments in the Indian automotive market. Dr. Arun Sharma, Head of Automotive Engineering at IIT Madras, highlighted the increasing trend towards electric vehicles (EVs) at a recent industry conference in Chennai. "Manufacturers are responding to the growing demand for sustainable mobility solutions," he stated.
normalised: This month saw a flurry of vehicle launches across various segments in the Indian automotive market. Doctor Arun Sharma, Head of Automotive Engineering at I I T Madras, highlighted the increasing trend towards electric vehicles (E V s) at a recent industry conference in Chennai. "Manufacturers are responding to the growing demand for sustainable mobility solutions," he stated.

unnormalised: Tata Motors unveiled its new electric SUV, the 'Nexon EV Max Eco', promising a range of 450 km on a single charge and a starting price of Rs. 16.49 Lakh. Maruti Suzuki launched the next generation of its popular hatchback, the 'Alto K10 CNG', targeting budget-conscious buyers with a fuel efficiency of 33.85 km/kg. Mahindra & Mahindra showcased its upcoming off-road vehicle, the 'Thar 5-Door', boasting enhanced space and features compared to its 3-door sibling.
normalised: Tata Motors unveiled its new electric S U V, the 'Nexon E V Max Eco', promising a range of four hundred and fifty kilometer on a single charge and a starting price of rupee sixteen point four nine lakh. Maruti Suzuki launched the next generation of its popular hatchback, the 'Alto K ten C N G', targeting budget-conscious buyers with a fuel efficiency of thirty three point eight five kilometer per kilogram. Mahindra and Mahindra showcased its upcoming off-road vehicle, the 'Thar five-Door', boasting enhanced space and features compared to its three-door sibling.

unnormalised: Analysts predict these launches will further intensify competition and accelerate the adoption of EVs in tier-2 and tier-3 cities. New dealerships are popping up across the nation, with some showrooms even incorporating green spaces of over 2000 sq ft.
normalised: Analysts predict these launches will further intensify competition and accelerate the adoption of E V s in tier-two and tier-three cities. New dealerships are popping up across the nation, with some showrooms even incorporating green spaces of over two thousand square feet.
